person.occupation: The author’s statement that the Mulāḥids (“heretics, infidels”) were also the rulers of “Qafirmistān”, does not help with their identification. item.name: qara çilek yapraġu
item.note: Plant is not determinable definitely

item.name: ḫarbük
qaraca otı
item.note: correct version: ḫarbaq (Arabic)

item.name: beş
item.note: Turkish: Muşmula, Beşbıyık, Döngel, Yenidünya

item.name: helhelīc
tūtiyā ḥabbi
item.note: plant or ingredient is not determinable

cit.sense: Indian mustard, or an Indian medicine very acrid and caustic
Fir-tree or the cone of such
Root of a certain lily plant ?

item.name: ḥaṣalband
item.note: Hasalban, cf. Turhan Baytop: Türkiyede Bitkiler ile Tedavi (Geçmişte ve Bugün). Istanbul 1984, p. 184; identity of the plant is not determinable definitely

item.name: qarġa düvelegi
item.note: Eşekhıyarı

item.name: m-r-ż-ī
item.note: plant is not determinable

cit.sense: Currants, sun-raisins; dried figs or dates

item.name: ṣufār
item.note: not determinable

item.name: bineviş ṣaqızı
item.note: Turkish: Menengiç Sakızı

cit.sense: The root of the blue lily

item.name: çeşm-zen

cit.sense: “A small black grain good for sore eyes”

item.note: Cf. Steingass, s.v. chashm-zan.

item.name: sulṭān mercümek
item.note: not determinable definitely

item.name: ḥavlincān
item.note: correct version: ḫavlincān.

item.name: ḥaṭmī toḫmı
item.note: correct version: ḫaṭmī

item.name: anṭola
peyġamber çiçegi
item.note: it is not sure if this flower is the same as peyġamber çiçegi as the flowers of peyġamber çiçegi are blue, but in the text it is given as having white flowers

cit.sense: Food flavored with onion and beans.

item.name: keci qılı
item.note: it was not able to find a plant with the name keçi qılı, but Keçisakalı cf. Baytop 1984: p. 419.

item.name: ḫuṣyetü ṣ-ṣāleb
item.note: very probably falsely for ḫuṣyetü s̱‑s̱aʿleb.

item.name: zurunbāṭ
item.note: correct version: zurunbād

item.name: yuvalaġlıq
item.note: plant yuvalaġlıq is not determinable

cit.sense: “a medicinal seed, name of a plant, of the nature of liver (as colour)” Cf. Steingass, s.v. jagarī.

item.name: penbe çekirdeg
item.note: not determinable

item.name: yevāqītü l-ʿulūm
Yevāqīt
item.note: a famous work which is attributed to Abū Ḥamīd al-Ġazālī.

item.name: fevāʾiḥ-i Miskīye
Fawāʾiḥ
item.note: Fevāʾiḥ‑i Miskiyye: Al-Fawāʾiḥ al-Miskīya fī Fawātiḥ al-Makkīya, written (in Arabic in 844/1440) by ʿAbd al-Raḥmān Bisṭāmī and dedicated to Sultan Murād II.

item.name: mevżūʿātü l-ʿulūm
item.note: Mevẓūʿātu l‑ʿulūm; Mawḍūʿāt al‑ʿUlūm: Kitāb miftāḥ al-saʿāda wa-miṣbāḥ al-siyāda fī mawḍūʿāt al-ʿulūm, written in 1557 by Taşköprüzāde Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafā (1495-1561); popular encyclopaedia.

cit.sense: The Yield of the Disciplines and the Merits of the Texts
quatrain; any poem with the rhyme scheme ax ax ax …

item.name: ǧāmiʿi l-asrār li-l-Manār
Şerḥ-i Cāmiʿ

cit.sense: Compendium of Secrets on the Lighthouse

item.note: commentary written by Qiwāmaddīn as-Saḥāwī al-Kākī (d. 1348) on the legal work Manār al-anwār fī uṣūl al-fiqh by an-Nasafī (d. 1310).

item.name: ṣaḥāyif-i Semerqandī
Ṣaḥāʾif-i Semerqandī
item.note: theological work (aka aṣ-Ṣaḥāʾif al-ilāhiyya); cf. EI2, VIII, s.v. al-Samarḳandī, Shams al-Dīn

item.name: tefsīr-i Kebīr
item.note: commentary; Mafāṭīḥ al-ġayb or Kitāb al-Tafsīr al-kabīr; cf. EI2, II, s.v. Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī

item.name: tārīḫ
item.note: Tārīḫu Ibn Kas̱īr: Al-bidāya wa‑n-nihāya (The Beginning and the End), is considered to be one of the most authoritative sources on Early Islamic history. The work deals with the beginning of the world's creation up to the 8th century.

item.name: mirʾatu z-zamān
item.note: famous universal history by Sibṭ ibn al-Ǧawzi (d. 1256)

item.name: siyaru ṣ-ṣaḥāba wa-z-zuhhād
item.note: not sure if this is a book title or a general reference to this kind of book; Siyaru ṣ‑ṣaḥāba wa‑z‑zuhhād wa‑l‑ʿulamāʿi l‑ʿubbād ("The Biographies of the Prophet's Companions, Ascetics and Pious Intellectuals"), written by Abū Muḥammad ʿAbdussalām bin Muḥammad al‑Ḫᵛārazmī al‑Andarskānī

item.name: ḥilyatu l-abrār
item.note: probably the Ḥilyat al-abrār wa-šiʿār al-aḫyār by an-Nawāwī (d. 1278). Cf. GAL I:497

item.name: tārīḫu l-ḥukamāʾ
item.note: a classical medieval history by Ibn al‑Qifṭī (d. 1248); contains biographies of philosophers, physicians and astronomers; cf. EI2, III, s.v. Ibn al-Ḳifṭī

item.name: kašfu l-ġamm fī tārīḫi l-umam

cit.sense: Revealing of Grief in the Chronicle of Nations

item.note: written by ʿAlī bin ʿĪsā al‑Irbilī (d. 1355-6)

item.name: eḥādīs̱-i erbaʿīn şerḥi
item.note: written by Ṣadruddīn Qonevī (d. 1274); “Ḳūnawī died after commenting on only 29 ḥadīt̲h̲s.” Cf. EI2, VIII s.v. Ṣadr al-Dīn Muḥammad b. Isḥāḳ b. Muḥammad b. Yūnus al-Ḳūnawī

item.name: şerḥ-i Meşārıq
Meşārıq
item.note: Tuḥfat al-abrār šarḥ Mašāriq al-anwār by Akmaladdīn al-Bābartī (d. 1384); cf. GAL II:81

item.name: maqāṣid
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "….."

item.name: şerḥu Mevāqıf
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "…."

item.name: ḥāşiye-i Şerḥ-i ʿAlī Quşcı
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "….."

item.name: şerḥ-i Mevāqif
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "…."

item.name: şerḥ-i Keşf
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "…."

item.name: šarḥi l-Miftāḥ
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "…."

item.name: kāfī
item.note: This name is not annotated correctly! Details: "…"

item.name: ʿUqlatu l-mustavfiz
item.note: ʿUqlat al-Mustawfiz a treatise written by Ibn al-ʿArabī (d. 1240)

item.name: behcetü t-Tevārīḫ
item.note: written (in Persian) by an unknown Şükrullah (d. after 1464); cf. TDVİA 39, s.v. Şükrullah

item.name: šarḥ Naqši l-Fuṣūṣ

cit.sense: Commentary on the Embroidery of the Seals

item.note: Persian commentary written by Mollā Ǧāmī (d. 1492) on Ibn al-ʿArabī’s Naqš al-Fuṣūṣ; cf. EI2, III, s.v. Ibn al-ʿArabī

item.name: niẓāmu t-Tevārīḫ
item.note: author: al-Bayḍāwī (d. 1316?); short encyclopaedic world history, written in Persian; cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Bayḍāwī and EIr IV, s.v. Bayżāwī, Nāṣer-al-Dīn

item.name: vīse vü Rāmīn
item.note: heroes of an 11th-century verse romance; cf. http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/vis-o-ramin

item.name: şerḥ-i Maqāṣıd
item.note: Maqāṣid aṭ-Ṭālibīn fī uṣūl dīn (fī l-kalām) by Taftāzānī

cit.sense: The Breath of Divine Intimacy (English translation of the title according to Huart in EI2); written by the famous Persian poet Abdarraḥmān Ǧāmī. Cf. EI2 II, s.v. Djāmī.
History of the Persian Kings author: ʿAlī Şīr Nevāʾī (d. 1501)

item.name: ḥāşiye-i Meṭāliʿ

cit.sense: Gloss on the Meṭāliʿ author: Luṭfullāh Ṭoqatī (d.1495), better known as Molla Luṭfī

item.note: Cf. TDVİA 30, s. v. Molla Lutfî.

cit.sense: The [Book of] Healing author: Ibn Sina Cf. GAL: SI:812-828.

item.name: hidāyetü l-ḥikmet
item.note: written by Abharī (d. 1264), a work on scholastic philosophy.

item.name: i̇şārāt
item.note: İşārāt-i Ebū ʿAlī = Kitāb al-Išārāt wa-l-tanbīhāt, written by Ibn Sīnā. For Ibn Sīnā’s bibliography cf. GAL: SI:812-828.

item.name: şerḥ-i İşārāt

cit.sense: The Commentary to the [Book of] Signs

item.note: written by Imam Fakhr-i Rāzī.

item.name: şerh
item.note: a commentary on Ibn Sīnā’s Book of Signs, written by Naṣīruddīn Ṭūsī (d. 1274).

item.name: muḥākamāt
item.note: This work dealt critically with the Išārāt of Ibn Sina. Written by Quṭbuddīn Šīrāzī

item.name: şerḥ-i Mevāqıf
Şerḥu Mevāqif
item.note: Supposedly the famous Šarḥ al-Mawāqif by Muḥammad al-Ǧurǧānī (14th cent.).

item.name: mecesṭī
item.note: name of the famous mathematical-astronomical treatise by Ptolemy. Here not the Almagest itself, but an introduction to it by Aṯīruddīn al-Abharī is meant.

item.name: heyʾet
item.note: The Kitāb al-Hayʾa by the Andalusian astronomer Ǧābir ibn Aflaḥ (d. mid 12th cent.).

item.name: qānūn-i Mesʿūdī
item.note: Abū Rayḥān al-Bīrūnī’s (d. after 1050) “Canon Masudicus” – Kitāb al-Qanūn al-Masʿūdī fi l-Hayʾa wa-n-Nuǧūm, dedicated to Sultan Masʿūd b. Maḥmūd of Ghazna, hence its name. Cf. EI² I, s.v. al-Bīrūnī.

item.name: teẕkire
item.note: At-taḏkira fī ʿilm al-hayʾa by Naṣīruddīn Ṭūsī.

item.name: mulaḫḫaṣ
item.note: Al-Mulaḫḫas fi l-hayʾa al‐basīṭa by al-Ǧaġmīnī. Cf. GAL SI:865.

item.name: nihāyetü l-idrāk
item.note: its full title is Nihāyat al-idrāk fī dirāyat al-aflāk. Cf. EI2 V, s.v. Ḳuṭb al-Dīn Shīrāzī.

cit.sense: The Commentary by Fażlullāh ʿUbeydī, cf. GAl SI:865. The commentaryT

item.name: şerḥ

cit.sense: The Commentary by Kamāl al‐Dīn al‐Turkmānī

item.note: Cf. GAl SI:865.

item.name: şerḥ
item.note: Cf. GAl SI:865.

item.name: fetḥīye
item.note: Ar-Risāla al‑Fatḥiyya by the astronomer and mathematician ‛Alī Kuşçu (d. 1474). Cf. TDVİA 2, s.v. Ali Kuşçu. Fazlıoğlu, İhsan (2007). „Qūshjī: Abū al‑Qāsim ʿAlāʾ al‑Dīn ʿAlī ibn Muḥammad Qushči‑zāde“, in: The Biographical Encyclopedia of Astronomers, Springer Reference. Thomas Hockey et al. (eds.). New York: Springer, 2007, pp. 946-948. İleri, İlay (2006) „Ali Al-Qushji and His Contributions to Mathematics and Astronomy”, Journal of the Center for Ottoman Studies, Ankara University (OTAM), vol. 20/2006, Ankara, pp. 175-183

item.name: şerḥ
item.note: full title is Ḥāshiya ʿalā sharḥ al-Mulaḫḫaṣ fī al-hay’a, a commentary on Çaġmīnī's Mulaḫḫaṣ.

item.name: şerḥ
item.note: Sharḥ al-Fathiyya fī ʿİlm al-Hay'a, commentary on ʿAlī Quşcı's work Al-Fathiyya fī ʿİlm al-Hay'a.

item.name: coġrāfyā
item.note: Ptolemy's treatise on cartography and his compilation of the knowledge in geography in the 2nd century. Cf. J. Lennart Berggren & Alexander Jones (2001). Ptolemy's Geography: An Annotated Translation of the Theoretical Chapters, Princeton University Press; Stückelberger, Alfred, and Gerd Graßhoff (eds). 2006.

cit.sense: The Foundations of Islamic Dogmas. “über Wesen und Eigenschaften Gottes, Bedeutung und Stellung der Prophetie und des Imāmats und die Auferstehung in 5 Kapp.” Cf. GAL GI:509.
The Disclosure; in GAL GI:509: “Taǧrīd al-ʿaqāʾid (al-kalām)”, in EI2 X, s.v. al-Ṭūsī, Naṣīr al-Dīn: “Tadjrīd al-iʿtiḳād/al-kalām”.
The Rising of the Stars Ṭavāliʿü l‑envār: Ṭawāliʿ al-anwār min maṭāliʿ al-anẓār. Cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Bayḍāwī.

The Deduction; Muḥaṣṣal afkār al-mutaqaddimīn wa ’l-mutaʾaḫḫirīn min al-ʿulamāʾ wa ’l-ḥukamāʾ wa ’l-mutakallimīn; “a précis of ideas, scholars, philosophers and mutakallimūn, ancient and modern”. Cf. EI2 II, s.v. Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī.
The Forty; Kitāb al-Arbaʿīn fī uṣūl ad-dīn. Cf. EI2 II, s.v. Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī.
The Quintessence. We could not identify the two mentioned works Lübāb and Erbaʿīn. Cf. Adıvar 19824:25 and EI2 I, s.v. Djamāl al-Dīn Aḳsarayī.
The Highest Degree of the Intellect. Nihāyat al-ʿuqūl fī dirāyat al-uṣūl. Cf. GAL GI:507.
The Views. Kitāb al-Mawāqif fī ʿilm al-kalām; cf. GAL GII:208.
Abstract of the “Gems of Theology” by Ażududdīn al-Īǧī. Cf. TDVİA 7, s.v. Cevâhirü'l-Kelâm.
Rectification of Theology Ṣadruššarīʿa aṯ-Ṯānī ʿUbaydullah left a prominent work by the title Taʿdīl al-ʿulūm, which presumably is meant by this reference.

item.name: şerḥ-i Tecrīd

cit.sense: The Commentary on “Disclosure”, a commentary on aṭ-Ṭūsī’s Taǧrīd al-ʿaqāʾid

item.note: Cf. GAL GI:509

cit.sense: Treatise on the Essential Element. Remark: The title is ambiguous because Kemalpaşazade wrote two treatises on the Essential Element, the Risāla fī taḥqīqi luzūmi l-imkān li-māhīyati l-mumkin and the Risāla fī ziyādati l-wuǧūd ʿalā l-māhīya. Cf. TDVİA 25, s.v. Kemalpaşazâde, section 3: “Kelâma Dair Görüşleri”.

item.name: maqṣad
item.note: al‑Maqṣad fī uṣuli d‑dīn, according to Brockelmann a “compendium of the principles of religion” by Akmaladdīn al-Bābartī al-Ḥanafī ad-Dimāšqī (d. 1384); cf. GAL II:80.

item.name: qavāʿid
item.note: We could not identify a work named Qavāʿid; it probably is a short name for one of the books written on jurisprudence by Ibn as-Sāʿāṭī (d. 1296). For his works cf. GAL GI:382 and SI:658.

item.name: muḫtaṣar
item.note: al-Muk̲h̲taṣar fi ’l-furūʿ or Djāmiʿ al-Ummahāt or simply al-Mukhtaṣar al-farʿī”. Cf. EI2 III, s.v. Ibn al-Ḥādjib.

item.name: minhāc
item.note: Minhāǧ al-wuṣūl ilā ʿilm al-uṣūl. Cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Bayḍāwī.

item.name: muḫtaṣar-i Ravża
item.note: A summary of the Rawżat al-nāẓir by Ibn Qudāmaā al-Maqdīsī. Cf. EI2 III, s.v. Ibn Ḳudāma al-Maḳdīsī.

item.name: menār
item.note: Manār al-anwār fī uṣūl al-fiqh by an-Nasafī (d. 1310). Cf. GAL S II:263.

item.name: şerḥ
item.note: Šarḥ manār al-anwār by Akmaladdīn al-Bābartī (d. 1384.). Cf. GAL II:80-81.

item.name: al-Muntaḫab
item.note: Kitāb al-muntaḫab fī uṣūl al-maḏhab. The author’s correct name is Ḥusāmaddīn al-Aḫsīkatī (d. 1247). Cf. GAL SI:654.

item.name: şerḥ-i Taḥqīq
item.note: Ġāyatu t-taḥqīq wa-ya-Šarḥu l-Ḥusāmī. Cf. TDVİA 1, s.v. Abdülazîz el-Buhârî.

item.name: şerḥ-i Tebyīn
item.note: At-tabyīn šarḥ al-Ḥusāmī; this, too, is a commentary on al-Muntaḫab (see above). Cf. GAL II:79.

item.name: taḥṣīl
item.note: At-taḥṣīl mina l-maḥṣūl by Sirāǧuddīn al-Urmawī (d. 1283), a Shāfiʿī jurist. Cf. TDVİA 37, s.v. Sirâceddin el-Urmevî.

item.name: müntahā s-sūʾāl ve-l-emel fī ʿilmeyi l-uṣūl ve-l-cedel

cit.sense: Goal of Questioning and Hopes Regarding Knowledge of Religion’s Foundations and of Discussion

item.name: i̇ḥkāmu l-aḥkam
item.note: al-Āmidī (d. 1233). Cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Āmidī.

item.name: maḥṣūl
item.note: Al-Maḥṣūl fī uṣūl al-fiqh by Faḫrueddīn Rāzī, cf. GAL G I:506.

item.name: tavżīḥ-i Şerḥ-i Tanqīḥ-i Metn
item.note: The title is not The title is not completely clear: Ṣadruššarīʿa aṯ-Ṯānī ʿUbaydullah (d. 1346) wrote a work Tanqīḥ al-Uṣūl, which he himself commented on later as at-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥalli ġawāmiḍi t-Tanqīḥ: probably this commentary is meant. Cf. TDVİA 35, s.v. Sadrüşşerîa.

item.name: telvīḥ
item.note: At-Talwīḥ. Cf. GAL GII:215-216. On Taftāzānī cf. EI2 X, s.v. al-Taftāzānī.

item.name: şerḥ-i Muḫtaṣar
item.note: Şarḥ muḫtaṣar al-uṣūl by Aḍudaddīn al-Īǧī (d. 1355). Cf. GAL GI:208-209.

item.name: ḫāşiye
item.note: on its author cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Abharī.

item.name: ḥavāşī
item.note: on their authors cf. EI2 X, s.v. al-Taftāzānī and EI2, II, s.v. Djurdjānī

item.name: şerḥ
item.note: on its author cf. EI2 I, s.v. al-Abharī.

item.name: taṣnīf
item.note: its author, Pazdawī Faḫr al-Islām (d. 1089) left several works on jurisprudence, though among them we could not identify a Taṣnīf or a work that includes this word.

item.name: şerḥ-i Taqrīr
item.note: a commentary on the work At‑taqrīr ʿalā uṣūli l‑Bazdawī by Şeyḫ Ekmelüddīn (Cf.: Kadir Recep Muhamed (2011) Ekmelüddîn Bâbertî ve Kelâm İlmindeki Yeri, Bursa: Uludağ Üniversitesi, Sosyal Bilimler Enstitüsü [unpublished Ph.D. thesis]).

cit.sense: The Smoothed Path; Kitāb al-Muwaṭṭāʾ, the main work of Mālik b. Anas (d. 796), jurist and eponymous founder of the Maliki school of law. Cf. EI2 VI, s.v. Mālik b. Anas.
The Collection Manẓūme: al-Manḍūmatu l-Nasafīya, an important Hanefi legal work by Naǧmaddīn ʿUmar Nafasī (d. 1142). Cf. TDVİA 32, s.v. Nesefî, Necmeddin.

item.name: zādu l-Mesīr

cit.sense: Provisioning for the Journey author: Ibn Cevzī (d. 1200)

item.note: Zād al-masīr fī ʿilm at-tafsīr. Cf. GAL GI:500-506.

item.name: vecīz
item.note: The work’s full title is: al-Waǧīz fī maʿānī l-Qurʾān al-ʿazīz. Cf. EI2 XI, s.v. al-Wāḥidī.

item.name: tefsīr-i vāẓiḥ

cit.sense: The Clear Exegesis author: Faḫruddīn Rāzī (?)

item.note: We could not identify a Tefsīr‑i vāziḥ among ar-Rāzī’s works; probably it simply means “the clear interpretation” in general and is not the title of a specific book.

item.name: tefsīr-i Celāleyn

cit.sense: The Exegesis of the two Jalāls authoors: Celālüddīn Maḥallī and Celālüddīn Suyūṭī.

item.note: According to the Encyclopaedia of Islam it was not as explained by Nevʿī, the other way round: The Tafsīr al-Ǧalalayn was written by Ǧalāladdīn al-Maḥallī (d. 1459), but completed by his pupil, the famous Ǧalāladdīn as-Suyūṭī (d. 1505). Cf. EI2 V, s.v. al-Maḥallī.

item.name: vasīṭ
item.note: The work’s full title is: = Al-Wāsīṭ bayna l-maqbūdi (l-Waǧīz ). Cf. EI2 XI, s.v. al-Wāḥidī.

item.name: tefsīr
item.note: Kitāb Taʾwīlāt al-Qurʾān by the Hanefi jurist Maḥmūd al-Māturīdī (d. 944). Cf. GAL GI 195.

item.name: keşşāf
item.note: Keşşāf; al-Kaššāf ʿan ḥaqāʾiq at-tanzīl wa-ʿuyūn al-aqāwīl fī wuǧūh at-taʾwīl by Maḥmūd az-Zamaḥšarī (d. 1144). Cf. GAL GI: 289-290.

item.name: tefsīr-i Tesyīr
item.note: = At-Taysīr fī (ʿilmi) t-tafsīr by Naǧmaddīn Nafasī (d. 1142). Cf. TDVİA s.v. 32, Nesefî, Necmeddin.

item.name: baṣīt
item.note: The work’s full title is: Al-Basīṭ fī tafsīr al-Qurʾān al-ʿaẓīm. Cf. EI2 XI, s.v. al-Wāḥidī.

item.name: mefātīḥü l-ġayb

cit.sense: The Keys of the Invisible World

item.note: = Kitāb at-Tafsīr al-kabīr. Cf. EI2 II, s.v. Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī.

item.name: tefsīr-i Lubābī
item.note: Lubāb an-nuqūl fī asbāb an-nuzūl by as-Suyūṭī (d. 1505). Cf. EI2 IX, s.v. al-Suyūṭī.

item.name: tefsīr
item.note: ʿAllāmā/ī is Quṭbuddīn aš-Šīrāzī, frequently quoted in the Netāʾic.

item.name: lubāb
item.note: supposedly the same Lubāb an-nuqūl fī asbāb an-nuzūl by as-Suyūṭī (d. 1505) mentioned above.

item.name: ḥaqāʾiq
item.note: written by Sullamī, whom we could not identify.

item.name: tefsīr-i Fātiḥa

cit.sense: Exegesis of the Sūra al-Fātiḥa remark: = Iʿǧāzu l-bayān fī taʾwīli Ummi l-Kitāb

item.note: Ṣadruddīn Qonevī's commentary on the first chapter in Qurʾān. Cf. Eren, Mehmet: Sadreddîn Konevî'nin Fatiha tefsiri ve tasavvufî hadis şerhçiliği, İstanbul 2010 and TDVİA 35, s.v. Sadreddin Konevî.

item.name: tefsīr
item.note: The Tefsīr-i Qāşānī probably is the mystical interpretation Taʾwīlāt al-Qur ʾān by Abdurrazzāq al-Kāşānī (d. 1335). Cf. TDVİA 25, s.v. Kâşânî, Abdürrezzâk.

cit.sense: Sources of the Exegeses; full title: ʿUyūn at-tafāsīr li-l-fuḍalāʾ as-samāsīr, called Tafsīr aš-Šayḫ by as-Siwāsī (d. end of 8th cent.). Cf. GAL II:228.

item.name: şāfī
item.note: No information on this title and its author.

cit.sense: Nourishment of the Hearts, Qūt al-qulūb fī muʿāmalat al-maḥbūb wa-waṣf ṭarīq al-murīd ilā maqām at-tawḥīd, the main work of al-Wāʿiẓ al-Makkī (d. 996). Cf. GAL GI:200.

item.name: futūḥāt-i Mekkīye

cit.sense: The Meccan Revelations. Al-Futūḥāt al-Makkīya fī asrār al-mālikīya wa-l-mulkīya by the famous mystic Muḥyi ad-Dīn Ibn al-ʿArabī (d. 1240).

item.note: Cf. EI2 III, s.v. Ibn al-ʿArabī.

item.name: fevāʾidü l-Ferāʾid

cit.sense: The Benefits of the Precious Gems

item.note: For this work cf. Kâtip Çelebi 2012:III:1039. (= Kâtip Çelebi: Keşfü’z-Zunûn An Esâmi’l-Kütübi ve’l-Fünûn (Kitapların Ve İlimlerin İsimlerinden Şüphelerin Giderilmesi). 5 vols. Arapçadan Tercüme Eden Rüştü Balcı. İstanbul: Tarih Vakfı Yurt Yayınları, 2012)

cit.sense: The Luminous Full Moon; its full title is Al-Badr al-munīr fī ʿilm at-taʿbīr, by an-Numayrī al-Ḥanbalī, better known as al-Maqdisī. Cf. GAL S I:913.
The Way of the Servants of God, full title: Mirṣād al-ʿibād min al mabdaʾ ila l-maʿād, written by ar-Rāzī Naǧmaddīn Dāya (d. 1256). An introduction into mysticism, written in Persian. Cf. GAL I:448.
The Lighthouses full title: Mānārāt as-sāʾīn ilā ḥaḍrat allāh wamaqāmat aṭ-ṭāʾīn billāh, by ar-Rāzī Naǧmaddīn Dāya (d. 1256). Cf. GAL I:448
The Hidden Secret . An astrological work by Faḫreddīn ar-Rāzī (d. 1209). Its full title is as-Sirr al-maktūm fī muḫāṭabat an-nuǧūm. Cf. GAL G I:506-507.
Book on Wish-fulfilling and Charms. We could not identify a compilation of ‛Alī’s sayings containing specifically this subject.
Book on Charms; al-Mustaġfīrī is not known with a book of this title. Cf. GAS I:353.
The the Compendium; the title Mūcez is the abbreviated form of Al-Mūǧaz al-Qānūn; it is an extract of the Qānūn of Ibn Sīnā written by Ibn el-Nefīs (d. 1288). Cf. EI2 III, s.v. Ibn al-Nafīs.
The Sufficiency Presumably the Kitābu l-Kifāya fī ṭ-Ṭibb by the Egyptian physician ‛Alī bin Rıẓvān (d. 1068[?]). Cf. TDVİA 20, s.v. İbn Rıdvân, Ali.
The Devotee’s Gift; full title Tuḥfatu l‑muḥibb fī ṣināʿati ṭ-ṭibb, written by the physician Qaysūnīzade (d. 1568). Cf. TDVİA 25, s.v. Kaysûnîzâde.
The Chosen; full title al-Muḫtārāt fī ṭ-Ṭibb, written by the physician Ibn Hubal (d. 1213). Cf. EI2 III, s.v. Ibn Hubal.
The Hundred; Nevʿī refers to the Kitābu l-Miʾa fī ṭ-Ṭibb by Abū Sahl al-Masīhī (d. 1010/11[?]), philosopher and physician. Cf. TDVİA 29, s.v. Mesîhî, Ebû Sehl.
The Perfect Skill; also known as the Kitābu l-Malikī by ‛Alī b. Al-ʿAbbās al-Maǧūsī (d. end of 10th cent.); a then very popular medical textbook for students. Cf. EI2 I, s.v. ʿAlī b. al-ʿAbbās.
The Felicitous Register; probably the Taẕkiratu Saʿdīya fī l-qawānīn aṭ-ṭıbbīya by ʿAbdarrazzāq al-Hauwām. Cf. GAL S II:1027.
The Canon; the medical masterwork of its time, written by Ibn Sīnā/Avicenna (d. 1037); its full title is Al-Qānūn fī ṭ-ṭibb. Cf. TDVİA 20, s.v. İbn Sînâ.
The Enraptured of the Disputers. We could not identify a book title Nişvānu l‑muḥāżirīn; one Ms. (NF 413, fol. 72r) had Nişvānu l‑āḫirīn.
The Prophetic Medicine, a genre of writings on medicine from the 9th century onwards which utilized the ideas and sayings about medicine in the Koran and hadiths. Cf. EI2 X, s.v. Ṭibb.

The Bond; this can be al-ʿUrwa li-Ahl al-Khalwa or Ṣafwat al-ʿUrwa, two versions of the same text by ʿAlāʾuddawla as-Simnānī (d.1336). Cf. GAL II:263 (for Ṣafwat al-ʿUrwa) and S II:281 (for al-ʿUrwa li-Ahl al-Khalwa).

item.name: bāb-i iştibāh
item.note: Cf. EI2 V, s.v. Ḳiyāfa: “al-Shāfiʿī wrote a Risāla fī ʿilm al-ḳiyāfa (Ḥādjdjī K̲h̲alīfa, i, 452; ms. Süleymaniyye, Mihrimah Sultan, 185, 4, in Turkish).” Probably the bāb-i iştibāh is included there.

cit.sense: Prodigies of Created Things, one of two works written by the famous cosmographer and geographer al-Qazwīnī, d. 1283. Cf. EI2 IV, s.v. al-Ḳazwīnī, Zakariyyāʾ b. Muḥammad b. Maḥmūd Abū Yaḥyā.

item.name: qāmūs
item.note: The famous Arabic-Arabic dictionary by Fīrūzābādī (d. 1415). Cf. TDVİA 24, s.v. el-Kāmûsü’l-Muhît.

cit.sense: title: Qānūn‑nāme‑i vilāyet‑i Üngürūs – “Code of regulations of the Hungarian province”
“elegy of love; the erotic-elegiac genre”; cf. EI2, s.v. Ghazal.
eulogy written in praise of God

item.name: i̇ḥyā

cit.sense: The revival of the religious sciences

item.note: full title: Iḥyāʾ ʿulūm ad-dīn, written by Ġazālī (d. 1111), cf. EI2, s.v. al-Ghazālī.

item.name: fetḥ-nāme
item.note: TDVİA, s.v. Fetihnâme.

item.name: i̇ncīl
item.note: Revelation transmitted by Jesus; cf. EI2, s.v. Indjīl.

cit.sense: historical and panegyrical long epic poem or prose work in praise of Selīm I. (1512-1520).

item.name: ḥiṣn Ḥaṣīn

cit.sense: al-Ḥiṣn al-ḥaṣīn min kalām Sayyid al-Mursalīn

item.note: “a collection of ḥadīth used for prayer”, cf. EI2, s.v. Ibn al-Djazarī.

cit.sense: The last two sūras of the Koran.

item.name: i̇lāhī

cit.sense: “a genre of popular poetry of religious inspiration, consisting of poems sung […] in chorus or solo during certain ceremonies”

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Ilāhī.

item.name: müseddes

cit.sense: stanzaic poem with stanzas consisting of six lines each

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Musammaṭ.

item.name: ġazel
item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Ghazal.

item.name: ʿamma
item.note: also known as An-Nabāʾ.

item.name: tebārek
item.note: is better known as Mulk.

item.name: naṣrī
iḏā ǧāʾa

cit.sense: probably the 110th sūra of the Koran

item.note: correctly known as An-Naṣr.

item.name: iẕā vaqaʿati
item.note: al-Wāqiʿa.

item.name: kitābi l-wafāʾi

cit.sense: complete title: Kitāb al-wafāʾ bi-taʿrīf faḍāʾil al-Muṣṭafā

item.note: author: Ibn al-Ǧawzī

item.name: izā s-samāʾu inšaqqat
alam našraḥ laka
item.note: also known as Al-Inšiqāq.

item.name: alam našraḥ laka
item.note: also known as Aš-Šarḥ.

item.name: ǧāmiʿi ṣ-ṣaġīr
item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. al-Suyūṭī.

item.name: şiʿr
item.note: usually a ġazel (love poem)

cit.sense: Ibn Malak authored a work entitled Mabāriq al-azhār fī šarḥ mašāriq al-anwār, which obviously is meant here

item.name: müs̱emmen

cit.sense: stanzaic poem with stanzas consisting of eight lines each

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Musammaṭ.

item.name: manāfiʿu n-nās

cit.sense: Treatise on medicine in prose with scatterd poems; written in 1566 by the poet and physician Nidāyī (m. after 1567)

item.note: Cf. Nuran Öztürk: Ankaralı Hekim Nidâî. Genc-i Esrâr-ı Ma’nî. Adana 2011, p. 42 and 49.

cit.sense: The 256th verse of the 2nd sūra of the Koran
“Treatise about the names of God in verse”

item.name: innā anzalnā
item.note: also known as Qadr.

item.name: mevlūd-i resūl
Muḥammedīye

cit.sense: original title: Vesīletü n-Necāt, a mes̱nevī in honour of the prophet Muḥammad

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Süleymān Čelebi, Dede.

cit.sense: The first sūra of the Koran.
The 256th verse of the 2nd sūra of the Koran.

item.name: kitāb-i reml-i ʿAlī

cit.sense: Book of divination attributed to ʿAlī, the forth caliph.

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Fāl-Nāma; Ertaylan: 1951: 35.

item.name: dürr-i Meknūn

cit.sense: Cosmographical work written by Aḥmed Yazıcıoġlu Bīcān (m. 1465‑6).

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Bīdjān.

item.name: kitāb-i iḥtilāc-nāme
item.note: Palmoscopy; cf. EI2, s.v. Ikhtilādj.

item.name: tevrāt
Tevrīt
item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Tawrāt.

item.name: zebūr
item.note: divine scripture; scripture of David, probably the Psalms Cf. EI2, s.v. Zabūr.

item.name: qurʾān
item.note: “The Muslim scripture, containing the revelations recited by Muḥammad”; cf. EI2, s.v. al-Ḳurʾān.

item.name: furqān
item.note: “divine revelation”; cf. EI2, s.v. Furḳān.

item.name: ḥarīqa-yi Envār
item.note: The title of a work written or used by Aḥmed al-Būnī.

cit.sense: obviously a work of the mentioned Aḥmed-i Yūyāfī [?]
17th sūra of the Koran; aka: al-Isrāʾ
the title of a work which is not determinable yet
26th verse of the third sūra (Āl ʿImrān) of the Koran.
The 256th verse of the 2nd sūra of the Quran.

item.name: murabbaʿ

cit.sense: stanzaic poem with stanzas consisting of four lines each

item.note: Cf. EI2, s.v. Musammaṭ.
